intro: Raphionacme welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch's raphionacme, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces delicate, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
